Hello! I've recently entered the [Elcano Challenge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113778-The-Elcano-Challenge-Ground-based-circumnavigation), which involves circumnavigating a body by land and sea (if applicable) only. I chose to enter this challenge on **Kerbin** and will be using a vehicle I designed for the race.

My plan is to head westward from KSC, and stick as close as possible to the equator. While this vehicle is amphibious, it uses significantly more fuel on water than land, so I will be choosing routes with the least amount of water as possible.

It runs off of Liquid Fuel, and when it runs out, I send a jet to re-fuel it.

I've decided that my quicksave/quickload rules are thus:

- Come to a full stop and quicksave every 20 minutes, or

- Quicksave after repairing a tire.

- If the vehicle is too damaged to continue, revert to last quicksave.

I'll be updating this thread as I go along.

> 
> How do you get the KER windows to turn into HUDs?

Well, kinda hard to explain in words, but basically, you mouse over the KER tab in the upper-right (while following a vessel). From there, you should see some buttons. The one you want is at the bottom (I believe) and says something like "Make a new window/box/something". You click on that and it brings up a dialog box where you choose which stats will be shown, and you can choose to have it in a box (like the regular KER window) or in HUD-style, like you've seen on my sceenies.

Hope that helps!

> 
> Why not build a seaplane?

Because the intent it to travel it by land and sea. By air is too simple... much easier to attain and maintain higher speeds, less issue with water, etc. etc.
